text: Lots to unpack in this thread. My 2p: I don’t think there’s a decline, I think there’s a shift. Some horse racing is less popular than it was 20 years ago, but betting on cricket and football are both a lot more popular. UK gamblers now have more access to US sports, which are high liquidity and where a lot of online influencers in gambling social media talk a confident game. Even liquidity in F1 is way higher than it was 15 years ago (thanks Netflix!), but obviously way fewer markets to trade. Some of this shifting in tastes pre-dates exchanges (look at pictures from greyhound tracks in the 1950s compared to 1990s), so I’m not convinced it’s all that modern a shift. There is plenty of non-UK money knocking around out there both on and off Betfair, not exposed to affordability/KYC noise, and while crypto is definitely grabbing the eye of some people, most of the people I know interested in it were never that interested in sports betting. I think most of the shift into that space has come from the day trader and FX crowd than anywhere else, closely followed by poker guys who don’t want to look at GTO solvers any more. I also think inflation has been a kicker, but that’s cyclic. I think online slots are horrific, and hope they get banned.

Some horse racing is less popular than it was 20 years ago, but betting on cricket and football are both a lot more popular. Even liquidity in F1 is way higher than it was 15 years ago (thanks Netflix!), but obviously way fewer markets to trade. Some of this shifting in tastes pre-dates exchanges (look at pictures from greyhound tracks in the 1950s compared to 1990s), so I’m not convinced it’s all that modern a shift. There is plenty of non-UK money knocking around out there both on and off Betfair, not exposed to affordability/KYC noise, and while crypto is definitely grabbing the eye of some people, most of the people I know interested in it were never that interested in sports betting. I think most of the shift into that space has come from the day trader and FX crowd than anywhere else, closely followed by poker guys who don’t want to look at GTO solvers any more. I also think inflation has been a kicker, but that’s cyclic. I think online slots are horrific, and hope they get banned.

This is the code: strategyMR = MarketRecorder(
            name="Market Recorder TPD",
            market_filter=betfairlightweight.filters.streaming_market_filter(
                market_ids=tpd_market_ids,
            ),
            stream_class=RaceDataStream,
            context={
                "local_dir": utils.configs.marketDataPathToday,
                "force_update": True,
                "remove_file": False,
                "remove_gz_file": False,
                "load_market_catalogue": True,
                "recorder_id": "",
            },
        )
        framework.add_strategy(strategyMR)

text:
Ah I assume you haven't done this to your marketrecorder to create a racerecorder

```Data Recorder
The example marketrecorder.py can be modified to record race and cricket data by updating the process_raw_data with the matching op and data keys.

marketSubscription mcm and mc
orderSubscription ocm and oc
cricketSubscription ccm and cc
raceSubscription rcm and rc```

elements.text: Ah I assume you haven't done this to your marketrecorder to create a racerecorder

Data Recorder
The example marketrecorder.py can be modified to record race and cricket data by updating the process_raw_data with the matching op and data keys.

marketSubscription mcm and mc
orderSubscription ocm and oc
cricketSubscription ccm and cc
raceSubscription rcm and rc
